column1: 3.3.3.2.1	 Summary of evidence and recommendations for diagnostic imaging in children

Medical expulsive therapy seems to be efficacious for treating patients with ureteral stones who are   amenable to conservative management. The greatest benefit might be among those with > 5 mm   (distal) ureteral stones.
Insufficient data exist to support the use of PDEI-5 or corticosteroids in combination with Î±-blockers   as an accelerating adjunct.
